ygData.subject: Re: Cleric Behaviour
ygData.msgSnippet: ***total roleplaying DO NOT TAKE AS PERSONAL PLEASE*** Ahhh I see the mutants are again speaking of the power of hate yet again. When will they learn, to
ygData.messageBody:
***total roleplaying DO NOT TAKE AS PERSONAL PLEASE***


Ahhh I see the mutants are again speaking of the "power" of hate yet again.

When will they learn, to hate everything, is to hate yourself. If you hate
yourself do yourself,your god, and the land a favor and just end your life.

As a follower of Tunare, the Mother of All (including the twisted Dark
Elves) it is my job to tend to the wounded and thoes in need of help. I do
this happly if I am able to do so and not putting the people under me in
danger due to lack of mana. And yes that also covers the fallen ones. I do
try and bring them back into the fold of Tunare as she is still your mother
and if you turn your back on the Dog of Hate, she am take you back. Come
back. Remember you are of our flesh, remember your heritage, remember your
nobility!

Jaxim High Cleric of Tunare
Tawer Marr


>From: "Realm Addict" <the_ninth_ring@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric Behaviour
>Date: Fri, 20 Aug 1999 21:42:22 PDT
>
>From: "Realm Addict" <the_ninth_ring@...>
>
>I can only concur. As a child of Hate, my only duty is to tend to
>Innoruuk's followers to ensure his greater glory. All others are merely
>fuel to feed his fires, like kindling.
>
>Vylkan, Servant of Hate
>Tallon Zek
>
>
>>From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric Behaviour
>>Date: Fri, 20 Aug 1999 20:51:01 -0700 (PDT)
>>
>>From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>>
>>On Fri, 20 Aug 1999 AsmodeusDP@... wrote:
>>
>> > I'm new to this mail list, and thought I would introduce myself with a
>>topic
>> > to discuss. I've often wondered what exactly it means to be a cleric
>>in
>> > Norrath. My personal opinion is that we should always be merciful to
>>those
>> > around us, and help in any way we can. Even if to heal someone we
>>don't
>>even
>> > know completely depletes our mana. What do you think of this?
>>
>>Perhaps that is what Karana asks of you.
>>But Innoruk is the God of Hate and Pain. Pain is real. You can't
>>avoid it. of all the gods, he is the only one honest with his followers.
>>He WANTS us killing everything. So why should I use the powers he gives
>>me on those who do not followhim, and will actively work against him?
>>
>>
>>
>>
